trans-unit.source: ms.ContentId: FBBAADE6-F1A1-4B5C-8FD2-BDCA3FCF81CA
trans-unit.target: ms.ContentId: FBBAADE6-F1A1-4B5C-8FD2-BDCA3FCF81CA

trans-unit.source: title: Step 6: Experiment with checkpoints
trans-unit.target: title: Step 6: Experiment with checkpoints

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Experiment with checkpoints
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Experiment with checkpoints

trans-unit.source: Checkpoints are a helpful tool when you want to save the present state of a virtual machine before making a change such as applying an update, installing software, or changing a setting.
trans-unit.target: Checkpoints are a helpful tool when you want to save the present state of a virtual machine before making a change such as applying an update, installing software, or changing a setting.

trans-unit.source: If the change causes issues, you can restore the checkpoint and go back.
trans-unit.target: If the change causes issues, you can restore the checkpoint and go back.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of checkpoints:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of checkpoints:

trans-unit.source: Production checkpoints: Used mainly on servers in production environments.
trans-unit.target: Production checkpoints: Used mainly on servers in production environments.

trans-unit.source: Standard checkpoints: Used in development or testing environments
trans-unit.target: Standard checkpoints: Used in development or testing environments

trans-unit.source: Production checkpoints are the default for Hyper-V on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Production checkpoints are the default for Hyper-V on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Change the checkpoint type
trans-unit.target: Change the checkpoint type

trans-unit.source: We'll start by trying out the older style of checkpoints, standard checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: We'll start by trying out the older style of checkpoints, standard checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: Since production checkpoints are the default, we need to go into the settings for the VM and change the checkpoint type.
trans-unit.target: Since production checkpoints are the default, we need to go into the settings for the VM and change the checkpoint type.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on Windows Walkthrough VM and select Settings.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on Windows Walkthrough VM and select Settings.

trans-unit.source: In the Management section, select Checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: In the Management section, select Checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: Select Standard checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: Select Standard checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: The dialog should look like this:
trans-unit.target: The dialog should look like this:

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to close the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Open Notepad to test checkpoints
trans-unit.target: Open Notepad to test checkpoints

trans-unit.source: In order to see what happens with each type of checkpoint, we'll run an application in the VM.
trans-unit.target: In order to see what happens with each type of checkpoint, we'll run an application in the VM.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on Windows Walkthrough VM and select Connect.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on Windows Walkthrough VM and select Connect.

trans-unit.source: In the virtual machine, open Notepad by clicking on the Start menu and typing Notepad and then select it from the results.
trans-unit.target: In the virtual machine, open Notepad by clicking on the Start menu and typing Notepad and then select it from the results.

trans-unit.source: In Notepad, type This is a test of checkpoints. The file should look like this:
trans-unit.target: In Notepad, type This is a test of checkpoints. The file should look like this:

trans-unit.source: Save the file as test.txt, but don't close Notepad.
trans-unit.target: Save the file as test.txt, but don't close Notepad.

trans-unit.source: Leave it running in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Leave it running in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Create a standard checkpoint
trans-unit.target: Create a standard checkpoint

trans-unit.source: To create the checkpoint, click on the Checkpoint button in the menu bar.
trans-unit.target: To create the checkpoint, click on the Checkpoint button in the menu bar.

trans-unit.source: In the checkpoint name dialog, type Standard.
trans-unit.target: In the checkpoint name dialog, type Standard.

trans-unit.source: The dialog should look like this:
trans-unit.target: The dialog should look like this:

trans-unit.source: When the process is complete, the checkpoint will appear under Checkpoints in the Hyper-V Manager.
trans-unit.target: When the process is complete, the checkpoint will appear under Checkpoints in the Hyper-V Manager.

trans-unit.source: Create a production checkpoint
trans-unit.target: Create a production checkpoint

trans-unit.source: Now, we need to change change the type of checkpoint that we want to take back to Production checkpoints before taking a second checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: Now, we need to change change the type of checkpoint that we want to take back to Production checkpoints before taking a second checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the virtual machine, and click Settings.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the virtual machine, and click Settings.

trans-unit.source: In the Management section, select Checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: In the Management section, select Checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: Select Production checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: Select Production checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: Clear the fall-back option.
trans-unit.target: Clear the fall-back option.

trans-unit.source: If the system can't take a production checkpoint, we want it to fail instead of taking a standard checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: If the system can't take a production checkpoint, we want it to fail instead of taking a standard checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: click OK to close the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: click OK to close the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the VM again and select Connect.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the VM again and select Connect.

trans-unit.source: In Notepad in the VM, type another line that reads This is a test of a production checkpoint and save the file again.
trans-unit.target: In Notepad in the VM, type another line that reads This is a test of a production checkpoint and save the file again.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Checkpoint button in the menu bar.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Checkpoint button in the menu bar.

trans-unit.source: When asked, name it Production and then click Yes.
trans-unit.target: When asked, name it Production and then click Yes.

trans-unit.source: Close VMConnect.
trans-unit.target: Close VMConnect.

trans-unit.source: The VM will continue running, you just won't be connected to it anymore.
trans-unit.target: The VM will continue running, you just won't be connected to it anymore.

trans-unit.source: In Hyper-V manager, your list of checkpoints will now look like this:
trans-unit.target: In Hyper-V manager, your list of checkpoints will now look like this:

trans-unit.source: Apply the standard checkpoint
trans-unit.target: Apply the standard checkpoint

trans-unit.source: In Hyper-V Manager, in the Checkpoints section, right-click the one titled Standard and click Apply.
trans-unit.target: In Hyper-V Manager, in the Checkpoints section, right-click the one titled Standard and click Apply.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up dialog, click Create Checkpoint and Apply.
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up dialog, click Create Checkpoint and Apply.

trans-unit.source: When the finished, your list of checkpoints will now look something like this:
trans-unit.target: When the finished, your list of checkpoints will now look something like this:

trans-unit.source: When this finishes, right-click the VM and the click Connect to connect to the VM.
trans-unit.target: When this finishes, right-click the VM and the click Connect to connect to the VM.

trans-unit.source: When you connect to the VM, the VM should be running, with Notepad open, but the line about production checkpoints will be missing:
trans-unit.target: When you connect to the VM, the VM should be running, with Notepad open, but the line about production checkpoints will be missing:

trans-unit.source: Close VMConnect, but leave the VM running.
trans-unit.target: Close VMConnect, but leave the VM running.

trans-unit.source: Apply the production checkpoint
trans-unit.target: Apply the production checkpoint

trans-unit.source: Now, let's go back to Hyper-V manager and apply the production checkpoint and see how our VM looks afterwards.
trans-unit.target: Now, let's go back to Hyper-V manager and apply the production checkpoint and see how our VM looks afterwards.

trans-unit.source: In the Checkpoints section, right-click the one titled Production Checkpoint and click Apply.
trans-unit.target: In the Checkpoints section, right-click the one titled Production Checkpoint and click Apply.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up dialog, pick Create Checkpoint and Apply.
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up dialog, pick Create Checkpoint and Apply.

trans-unit.source: When this finishes, right-click the VM and the click Connect to launch the VM.
trans-unit.target: When this finishes, right-click the VM and the click Connect to launch the VM.

trans-unit.source: You'll notice that the VM is not running.
trans-unit.target: You'll notice that the VM is not running.

trans-unit.source: Click on the <linkText></linkText> Start button in the menu bar to start the VM.
trans-unit.target: Click on the <linkText></linkText> Start button in the menu bar to start the VM.

trans-unit.source: Open open test.txt in Notepad.
trans-unit.target: Open open test.txt in Notepad.

trans-unit.source: You should see the line in the file about testing production checkpoints:
trans-unit.target: You should see the line in the file about testing production checkpoints:

trans-unit.source: Rename a checkpoint
trans-unit.target: Rename a checkpoint

trans-unit.source: Right-click the last checkpoint in the tree and click Rename.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the last checkpoint in the tree and click Rename.

trans-unit.source: Name the checkpoint Delete me.
trans-unit.target: Name the checkpoint Delete me.

trans-unit.source: Delete a checkpoint
trans-unit.target: Delete a checkpoint

trans-unit.source: The previous step has probably given you a hint about what we'll do next.
trans-unit.target: The previous step has probably given you a hint about what we'll do next.

trans-unit.source: We are going to delete the checkpoint that you just renamed.
trans-unit.target: We are going to delete the checkpoint that you just renamed.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the checkpoint named Delete me and click Delete checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the checkpoint named Delete me and click Delete checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: In the warning dialog, click Delete.
trans-unit.target: In the warning dialog, click Delete.

trans-unit.source: After the checkpoint is deleted, your list should look something like this:
trans-unit.target: After the checkpoint is deleted, your list should look something like this:

trans-unit.source: Next Step:
trans-unit.target: Next Step:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Test
trans-unit.target: Test
